description: Infinix Hot 60i has launched in Bangladesh, as the first arrival in the upcoming Hot 60 lineup. This new smartphone boasts a 6.78-inch 120Hz LCD screen, a MediaTek Helio G81 SoC, and up to 256GB of storage. It features a 50-megapixel primary rear camera, and runs on a 5,160mAh battery.
title: Infinix Hot 60i Launched With MediaTek Helio G81 Ultimate SoC, 50-Megapixel Rear Camera

description: OpenAI is said to be renting Google's AI chips for ChatGPT and other products. While a major Nvidia GPU purchaser, OpenAI is now utilising Google's Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) for both model training and inference. This move expands Google's external TPU availability, previously reserved for internal use, helping them secure other major tech clients and AI startups.
title: OpenAI Said to Turn to Google's AI Chips to Power ChatGPT and Other Products

description: Samsung's first tri-fold smartphone might be unveiled alongside the Galaxy Z Fold 7 and Flip 7 at the July 9 Galaxy Unpacked event. A tipster claims that while the triple-folding phone might be teased on July 9, it is only expected to be available later this year. Huawei beat Samsung to launch the Mate XT Ultimate Design as the first commercially available tri-fold phone in 2024.
title: Samsung Tipped to Unveil Tri-Fold Smartphone With Galaxy Z Fold 7, Z Flip 7; Launch Timeline Leaked

description: Apple's iPhone 17 model is tipped to feature a larger display than the current iPhone 16. Previous leaks also suggested a bigger iPhone 17 handset, which could match the iPhone 16 Pro's screen size. Additionally, the standard iPhone 17 display is anticipated to arrive with a 120Hz refresh rate later this year.
title: iPhone 17 to Feature Slightly Larger Display Than iPhone 16, Tipster Claims

description: Microsoft's next-gen Maia AI chip, codenamed Braga, reportedly faces a delay of at least six months, pushing mass production to 2026. A report by The Information reveals that this is due to design changes, staffing issues, and high turnover. Once released, the chip is expected to underperform Nvidia's Blackwell, impacting Microsoft's plans to deploy Braga in its data centres this year.
title: Microsoft's Next-Gen AI Chip Production Reportedly Delayed to 2026
